Pre-Game Insights: France faces Poland in a crucial UEFA Euro match on Tuesday, June 25, 2024, at BVB Stadion Dortmund in Germany.
Kylian Mbappé's availability for France remains uncertain due to a broken nose sustained in France’s opening 1-0 win over Austria.
France needs a point to guarantee a place in the round of 16 but has likely done enough to advance.
Poland has already been eliminated from the tournament after losing its opening two games.
Poland captain Robert Lewandowski, who turns 36 in August, missed the game against the Netherlands due to a thigh injury and was a substitute against Austria.
This could be Lewandowski's last-ever European Championship match.
For France, much depends on Mbappé's availability. If he returns, Antoine Griezmann will likely drop back into midfield.
Poland coach Michal Probierz announced that Wojciech Szczęsny will be replaced as goalkeeper for the final group match.
Wojciech Szczęsny has announced his retirement from international soccer after these Euros.
Miscellaneous Highlights: N’Golo Kante has two player-of-the-match awards already at Euro 2024, despite not having played a competitive match for France in two years before this tournament.
France hasn’t lost any of its eight group games at European Championships under Didier Deschamps.
With 47 goals for France, Mbappé is four goals away from tying with Thierry Henry in the list of all-time top scorers for the national team.
Poland has failed to advance from the group stage in four of its last five appearances at the European Championship.
Lewandowski has 82 goals in 151 appearances for Poland.
